utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey. Watcha guys doin?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Monica's making us watch Old Yeller.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Why are you guys so upset? It's Old Yeller, it's a happy movie.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What're you talkin' about?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: C'mon, happy family gets a dog, frontier fun.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah but Phoebs, what about the end?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What when Yeller saves saves the family from the wolf and everyone's happy?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That's not the end.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yu-huh. That's when my mother would shut off the TV and say 'The end'.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What about the part where he has rabies?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: He doesn't have rabies, he has babies. That's what my mom said.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, Phoebe, I don't think your mom would want you to see what's about to happen.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What, what's about to happen? I've never seen this part before. Hey, Travis, watcha doin' with that gun? Oh no, no no Travis, put down the gun. No no no no, he he's your buddy, he's your Yeller, no, no no, the end, THE END.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, have you guys eaten, because uh, Richard and I just finished and we've got leftovers... Chicken and potatoes... What am I wearing?...Actually, nothing but rubber gloves.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ya know, one of these times you're gonna really be naked and we're not gonna come over.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, I've got a leg, three breasts and a wing.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, how do you find clothes that fit?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Monica, we've got a question.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, for the bizillionth time, yes I see other women in shower at the gym, and no I don't look.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, not that one. We're trying to figure out who to bring to the Knicks game tonight, we have an extra ticket.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, Ross can't go so it's between my friend Eric Prower who has breath issues and Dan with the poking. 'Did you see that play? Do you want some more beer? Is that Spike Lee?'

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok. Hey, why don't you ask Richard?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok, uh, hey Richard, if you had an extra ticket to the Knicks game and you had to choose between a friend who smells and one who bruises you who would you pick?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Wow. Well being a huge Knicks fan myself, I think you should take someone who's a huge Knicks fan.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, that's Eric.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Glad to be of help. Matches.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I meant, why don't you take Richard to the game? What?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: C'mon. Keeps his fingers to himself and he's always minty fresh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I don't know, Richard's really nice and everything, uh, it's just that we don't know him really well, ya know, and plus he's, ya know, old -er than some people, but, uh, younger than some buildings.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So what, he's a little older, big deal, I mean he's important to me. Ya know if you ask him, he might take you on his Jag.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How do we say yes now and make it seem like we're not doin' it just to ride in the cool car?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, this could be tough.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok ok ok ok. Monica, we'll bring him, but only if he takes the Jaguar.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ooh, you almost had it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No no, you're fine, you're fine.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Hello

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Hi honey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh you guys are not gonna believe what happened.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, we were sitting over there playing on the floor and he grabs the table and he pulls himself up. He pulled himself up. Standing man. I'm sorry you guys missed it but I did tape it so it you guys want to see it.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Uhh, we know, he already did it last week.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: You can watch our tape if you want.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't believe this. I miss, I miss the first time of everything. I missed, what, the first time he rolled over, the first time he crawled. What else did I miss? Has he spoken yet, is he driving, does he have a favorite liquour?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Actually, he is getting closer on the talking thing. He can't quite say mama yet, but once he said yumen.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ooh, I, I'm so sick of missing stuff. Ya know, I want him for more than, than a day, I want him for a whole weekend. No listen , I mean, I feel like-

utterance.speaker: CAROL and SUSAN
utterance.content: Great. That would be fine.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Really? I mean, I, I had a whole speach prepared.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: Oh shout, that would have been fun.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh look, did, did you just see that? Did you see? He just waved, he just waved, he's never waved before, you've never waved before. Yes he has. Very good.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs, whatcha got there?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, Love Story, Brian's Song, and Terms of Endearment.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow, all you need now is The Killing Fields and some guacamole and you've got yourself a part-ay.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, I talked to my grandma about the Old Yeller incident, and she told me that my mom used to not show us the ends of sad movies to shield us from the pain and sadness. You know, before she killed herself.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey. Where is he, where's Richard? Did you ditch him?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah right after we stole his lunch money and gave him a wedgie. What's the matter with you, he's parking the car.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So'd you guys have fun?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Your boyfriend is so cool.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, he let us drive his Jaguar. Joey for 12 blocks, me for 15.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow, he must like you the best.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, what about that thing he did when he tipped the guy who showed us to our seats. You never even saw the money, it was like this. Hey Chandler, thanks for showing us to our seats .

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You're welcome. Hey Joey, thanks for parking the car .

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No problem. Hey Chandler

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I think they get it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: There's the man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: He-he-eyy.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey, you're gettin' better. I'm gonna keep this by the way.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok. He kept my dollar.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So your first whole weekend without Ben, what're you guys gonna do?

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Uh, we're going down to Colonial Williamsburg.

utterance.speaker: SUSAN
utterance.content: Yeah, a woman I went to college with just became the first female blacksmith down there.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, ya know, they're a little behind the times in Colonial Williamsburg.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: Think I better go before mommy starts weeping.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Buy mommy.

utterance.speaker: CAROL and SUSAN
utterance.content: We love you. Buy.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Have a good time. Ok, Ben.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Look. Joey, do you know we can see you from here?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How come Richard looks so much cooler with one of these than me?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well for starters, you may want to light it and lose the spatula.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know what, I think it's cute, you trying to be more like Richard.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Not like him, per-se, just not un-like him.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look it's the artist formerly known as Chandler.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Just tryin' somethin' here, ya know.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So Joey, why didn't you grow a moustache?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh we flipped for it. I got the cigar, he got the moustache. Figured if we both grew it, we'd look like dorks.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, you really sidestepped that land mine.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey listen, we've gotta go, I promised Richard we'd meet him downstairs.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You're meeting Richard?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, we're goin' to a Ranger game.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, didn't he tell ya?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, he told me he was going out with the guys, I just didn't know that you were the guys.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You hear that? We're the guys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: We're the guys.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: With that moustache doesn't Chandler remind you of Aunt Sylvia?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi, we're visitiing. It's Ben and his da-da. Da-da. Can you say da-da? Look, I'm gonna tell your momies you said it anyway so you might as well try.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No luck huh?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Naa. A while ago I got a sah out of him, which I thought, ya know, might turn into sah-condary caregiver but... Hey, would you uh, would you hold him for a sec, 'cause I, I gotta take this off.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, yeah sure, Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh, I'm holding Ben.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, well, he's a baby not a bomb.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well just hold him like you'd hold a football.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: This is how I would hold a football.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, here, here. There we go.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, I'm sorry, I'm just not very good with babies. I mean I haven't been around them, I mean, you know, since I was one.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It's alright, it's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, definitely, I'm sure you'll feel totally different when it's our baby.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You think about stuff like that?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uhh, yeah. I mean, actually I kinda think that we'll have, we'll have two babies.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Two, two babies?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah. Ya know, a boy and a girl. Hopefully the girl will come first so Ben here won't feel too competitive.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Then what's gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, we won't wanna raise kids in the city so we'll probably move to uh, Scarsdale.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, that way I figure, ya know, we'll be far enough away from our parents that we don't have to see them all the time but close enough that they can come over and babysit whenever we want. And yes, I know, the taxes are a little higher than, let's say, Nassau county but the school system's supposedly great.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow. Wow, that's great. Great. Ok, wow, you know what.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I'm off my break now so uh, um here you take this and um, I am gonna go pour these very nice people some coffee. Ok. Oh look at that, I don't have a pot. I don't have a pot. Well, hey, maybe I've got one at home, or in Scarsdale. Hey is that a door?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs, what's happening?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, ok, murder, cancer, soccer teams eating each other in the Andes.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So you watched the movies huh?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uh huh, what is happening to the world? I mean, no no no, 'cause ET leaves, and and Rocky loses, Charlotte dies.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Charlotte who?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: With the web, the spider she dies, she does. She has babies and dies. It's like ya know, hey welcome home from the hospital, thud.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, you wanna feel better?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, here, watch this.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's a Wonderful Life. Yes I've heard of this.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So you can't lose, it's there in the title. Wonderfullness is baked right in.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Please, I almost fell for that with, uh, Pride of the Yankees, I thought I was gonna see a film about Yankee pride and then, boom, the guy gets Lou Gehrig's disease.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, the guy was Lou Gehrig. Didn't you kinda see it coming?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Phoebe, just watch that, I promise it will resotre all your faith in humanity.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, big guy, game time.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey, be right there.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: There's a game?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I just got my pick-up sticks back from the shop. Bring your nerves of steel.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: It's the basketball playoffs.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Listen, um honey, I appreciate this but you don't have to keep hanging out with them for me, I mean, they have each other.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh, no, honey, I mean, don't worry, I like hanging out with those guys. It's fun for me. They're different than my other friends, they don't start sentences with, 'You know who just died shoveling snow?'

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright that's great, then just go. Go Knicks.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, it's the college playoffs.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, then go Vassar.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, they're not in it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, then just go.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, why does this bother me so much? I mean I don't wanna be one of those people who tells their boyfriend they wanna spend 24 hours a day with them.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's just that he doesn't have that much free time, ya know, and I don't know, what do I do?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Does it matter? You're ultimately just gonna die or get divorced or have to blow your pets head off.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Aghh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I've got a question. Richard made plans again with the guys.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah well, Ross just made plans for the whole century.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ya know what, I think I'm gonna go to my room and read Cosmo, maybe there's something helpful in there. Know what, at least maybe I can learn how to do an at home bikini wax with leftover Cristmas candles.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, what the hell happened back there?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I don't know, you tell me. One minute I'm holding Ben like a football, the next thing I know, I've got two kids, I'm living in Scarsdale complaining about the taxes.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well I'm sorry, I think about stuff. Ya know, I mean, you're at work, you're assembling bones, your mind wanders.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ross, you have planned out the next 20 years of our lives, we've been dating for six weeks.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon, what, you never think about our future?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes, but I, I think about who's apartment we're gonna sleep at tomorrow night and, and where we're gonna have dinner next Saturday night. I do not think about what our childrens' names are gonna be. You know what our childrens names are gonna be.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, no, I mean, ya know, I, I read a book and there was a girl named Emily and I thought, I thought that might be good.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What was the book?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: The big book of childrens' names.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, Ross, Ross, ok listen, what we have is amazing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: But I do not want to have everything decided for me. I spent my whole life like that. It's what I had with Barry, that was one of the reasons I left. I, I like not knowing right now and I'm sorry if that scares you but if you want to be with me you are gonna have to deal with that.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok fine.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: We're not done.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I didn't know that.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, then you're gonna have to understand that you're with a guy who's not gonna stop planning his future with you because he knows that we're gonna end up together and if that scares you, tough, 'cause you're gonna have to deal with that.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Fine, I will.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Good, 'cause I love you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well I love you too.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well that's the first time we've said that.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes it is.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, I'm gonna kiss you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well you better.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey. Oh thanks for the great movie tip.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Did you like it?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh yeah. You know, I don't know if I was happier when um George Bailey destroyed the family business or um, Donna Reid cried, or when the mean pharmacist made his ear bleed.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, I'll give you the ear thing but don't you think the ending was pretty wonderful?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I didn't watch the ending, I was too depressed. It just kept getting worse and worse, it should have been called, "It's a sucky life and just when you think it can't suck any more it does."

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Kick save and... denied.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: But... he gets it back, pass to the middle, lines it up and... BAM! Yes! Could that shot BE any prettier?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man you are incredible.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well, we had a table in college.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh really, I didn't know they had foosball in the 1800's.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Nice moustache by the way. When puberty hits that thing's really gonna kick in.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Honey. Uh, not to sound too Florence Henderson but, dinner's on the table.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ok, just one more point.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Score! Now can we go?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: See, that's why we don't let her play.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Is everything all right?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh hey listen, don't be mad at him, it's our fault. I'm sorry we've been hoggin so much of his time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, he's just really great to hang around with.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No no, seriously, Chandler and I were just talkin about this. He is so much cooler than our dads. I mean, you know, our dad's are ok, ya know, but Richard is just- ow, ow. What are you kickin me for? Huh? I'm tryin to talk here.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, you guys see me as a dad?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Nooooo.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Your just, your just clearly not familiar with our young persons vernacular. See, when we say dad, we mean buddy. We mean pal.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No no, seriously, Joey's my dad, Monica's my dad. I've even got some dads down at work.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: That's fine. Well, your other dad and I are gonna go have a romantic evening and I guess I'll just see you kids around.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Nighty-nite.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You're not a dad. You're not a dad.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Not a dad.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I can't believe you got us into trouble.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So are you ok?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Yeah, just, I feel like I'm about a hundred. I thought I was just one of the guys.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Come here. I'll make you feel like one of the guys. You know for a really cool guy, you suck at foosball.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: What're you talkin' about, I was killin' 'em.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, well they suck too.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, and then you take the poopie diaper and you put it in the poopie diaper pail.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok Ross, just so you know, calling it a poopie diaper doesn't make this process any cuter.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CAROL
utterance.content: It's us.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Come on up. I'm gonna get the rest of his stuff together.
